text: leonard_hofstadter Okay , the X10s are online .

howard_wolowitz Gentlemen , I am now about to send a signal from this laptop through our local ISP , racing down fiber - optic cable at the speed of light to San Francisco , bouncing off a satellite in geosynchronous orbit to Lisbon , Portugal , where the data packets will be handed off to submerged transatlantic cables terminating in Halifax , Nova - Scotia , and transferred across the continent via microwave relays back to our ISP and the X10 receiver attached to this lamp .

leonard_hofstadter Sheldon , why is this letter in the trash ?
sheldon_cooper Well , there 's always the possibility that a trash can spontaneously formed around the letter , but Occam 's Razor would suggest that someone threw it out .
leonard_hofstadter It 's from the Institute for Experimental Physics . They want us to present our paper on the properties of super solids at the topical conference on Bowes - Einstein condensates .
sheldon_cooper I know . I read it before I threw it out .
leonard_hofstadter Okay ... if I may drill down to the bedrock of my question , why did you throw it out .

sheldon_cooper Because I have no interest in standing in the Rose Room of the Pasadena Marriott in front of a group of judgmental strangers , who would n't recognize true genius if it were standing in front of them giving a speech . Which , if I were there , it would be .
howard_wolowitz I do n't know , Sheldon , those topical conferences on Bowes - Einstein condensates parties are legendary .
leonard_hofstadter Forget the parties .
howard_wolowitz Forget the parties ? What a nerd .
leonard_hofstadter Are there any other honors I 've gotten that I do n't know about ? Did UPS drop off a Nobel Prize with my name on it ?
sheldon_cooper Leonard , please do n't take this the wrong way , but the day you win a Nobel Prize , is the day I begin my research on the drag co - efficient of tassles on flying carpets .
raj_koothrappali Hoo - hoo - hoo . The only thing missing from that insult was ' yo mamma . '
howard_wolowitz I 've got one , hey Leonard , your mamma 's research methodology is so flawed ... .
leonard_hofstadter Shut up , Howard . Sheldon , we have to do this .
sheldon_cooper No we do n't . We have to take in nourishment , expel waste , and inhale enough oxygen to keep ourselves from dying , everything else is optional .
leonard_hofstadter Okay , let me put it this way , I 'm doing it .
sheldon_cooper You ca n't . I 'm the lead author .
leonard_hofstadter Oh , come on . The only reason you 're the lead author is because we went alphabetically .

sheldon_cooper I let you think we went alphabetically to spare you the humiliation of dealing with the fact that it was my idea . Not to put too fine a point on it , but I was throwing you a bone . You 're welcome .
leonard_hofstadter Excuse me , I designed the experiment that proved the hypothesis .
sheldon_cooper It does n't need proving .
leonard_hofstadter So the entire scientific community is just supposed to take your word ?
sheldon_cooper They 're not supposed to , but they should .
leonard_hofstadter Alright , I do n't care what you say , I 'm going to the conference and I 'm presenting our findings .
sheldon_cooper And I forbid it .
leonard_hofstadter You forbid it ?
sheldon_cooper If I 'm not taking credit for our work then nobody is .
leonard_hofstadter Oh , you admit that it 's our work .
sheldon_cooper No , once again , I 'm throwing you a bone . And once again , you are welcome .
leonard_hofstadter Ah !
howard_wolowitz Oh no he dit'nt !
penny So , how 's it going with Sheldon , are you guys still not talking to each other ?

leonard_hofstadter Not only is he still not talking to me , but there 's this thing he does where he stares at you and tries to get your brain to explode . You know , like in the classic sci - fi movie Scanners ? You know , bzzz - pchew ! Never mind . How about this one . It says , ' I know my physics , but I 'm still a fun guy ! '

leonard_hofstadter They do n't , that 's why I saved this one .
penny Okay , well , let 's just see what else you have . Okay , here , take this , and this , and this , and these .
leonard_hofstadter Is this all stuff you want me to try on ?
penny No , this is stuff I want you to throw out .
leonard_hofstadter Oh .
penny Seriously , do n't even give it to charity , you wo n't be helping anyone . What 's this .
leonard_hofstadter Oh , that 's the bottled city of Kandor .
penny Uh - huh .
leonard_hofstadter You see , Kandor was the capital city of the planet Krypton , it was miniaturised by Brainiac before Krypton exploded and then rescued by Superman .
penny Oh , nice .
leonard_hofstadter It 's a lot cooler when girls are n't looking at it .
penny Here , why do n't you put these on while I find a shirt and sport - coat to match .
leonard_hofstadter Great , be right back .
penny Well , where you going , just put them on .
leonard_hofstadter Here ?
penny Oh , are you shy ?
leonard_hofstadter No , I 'm not shy .
penny Do n't worry , I wo n't look .
leonard_hofstadter I know you wo n't look , why would you look , there 's nothing to see , well , not nothing ... .
penny Sweetie , put the pants on .
leonard_hofstadter Putting them on .
penny So , you know , is n't there maybe some way you and Sheldon could compromise on this whole presentation thing .
leonard_hofstadter No . No . Scientists do not compromise . Our minds are trained to synthesize facts and come to inarguable conclusions . Not to mention , Sheldon is batcrap crazy .
penny What is this ?
leonard_hofstadter Oh , careful . That 's my original series Battlestar Galactica flight suit .
penny Oh , why did n't you wear it at Halloween ?
leonard_hofstadter Because it 's not a costume , it 's a flight suit .
penny Okay , alright , moving on , oh , wow , a paisley shirt .
leonard_hofstadter Uh - huh , it goes with my corduroy suit .
penny If you mean it should end up in the same place then , I agree . Is this your ... your only tie ?
leonard_hofstadter Ah . Technically yes , but , if you 'll notice , it 's reversible . So it works as two .
penny Oh , sweetie , I do n't think it even works as one . Is this all your clothes ?
leonard_hofstadter Yeah . Everything since the eighth grade .
penny The ... the eighth grade ?
leonard_hofstadter My last growth spurt .
penny Okay , well , I guess we 're back to the corduroy suit .
leonard_hofstadter Great .
penny Yup . I said no , put it down .
penny Hey Sheldon !
sheldon_cooper Hello Penny .
penny Get anything good ?
sheldon_cooper Uh , just the latest copy of Applied Particle Physics Quarterly .
penny Oh , you know , that is so weird that yours came and mine did n't . . It was a joke . Yup , tip your waitresses , I 'm here all week .
sheldon_cooper Penny , just to save you from further awkwardness know that I 'm perfectly comfortable with the two of us climbing the stairs in silence .
penny Oh yeah , me too . Zip it , lock it . Put it in your pocket . So you and Leonard ... .
sheldon_cooper Oh dear God !
penny Little misunderstanding , huh .
sheldon_cooper A little misunder ... Galileo and the Pope had a little misunderstanding .
penny Anyway , I was talking to Leonard this morning and I think he feels really bad about it .
sheldon_cooper Huh .
penny Well how do you feel ?
sheldon_cooper I do n't understand the question .
penny Well I 'm just asking if it 's difficult to be fighting with your best friend .
sheldon_cooper Oh . I had n't thought about it like that . I wonder if I 've been experiencing physiological manifestations of some sort of unconscious emotional turmoil .
penny Wait ... what ?
sheldon_cooper I could n't poop this morning .
penny You should just talk to him , I 'm sure you guys can work this out .
sheldon_cooper It 's certainly preferable to my plan .
penny Which was ?
sheldon_cooper A powerful laxative .

penny Okay , so you absolutely should talk to him , look , I know Leonard values you as a friend , and he told me himself that without your little idea there 's no way he could have come up with this whole experiment thing .
sheldon_cooper Excuse me , little idea ?
penny Yeah , I mean he tried to explain it to me , I did n't really understand it but ... .
sheldon_cooper Of course you did n't , he said little idea ?
penny Uh , well no , no , not in ... not in those words .

penny Um , gee , the exact words are n't written ... it 's more the spirit in which it 's .

leonard_hofstadter I was n't expecting such a crowd , I 'm a little nervous .

The physicist then does some calculations , and he says , um , I have a solution , but it only works with spherical chickens in a vacuum . Right ?

penny I really should have brought my own car .

leonard_hofstadter So , in conclusion , the data show that at temperatures approaching absolute zero , the moment of inertia changes , and the solid becomes a super - solid , which clearly appears to be a previously unknown state of matter . Thank you . Are there any questions ?
voice Yeah . What the hell was that ?
leonard_hofstadter Any other questions ?

sheldon_cooper Doctor Sheldon Cooper here , I am the lead author of this particular paper . Thank you . And you , sir , you have completely skipped over the part where I was walking through the park , and I saw these children on a merry - go - round , which started me thinking about the moment of inertia in gasses like helium at temperatures approaching absolute zero .
leonard_hofstadter I did n't skip it , it 's just an anecdote . It 's not science .
sheldon_cooper Oh , I see , was the apple falling on Newton 's head , was that just an anecdote ?
leonard_hofstadter You are not Isaac Newton .
sheldon_cooper No , no that 's true , gravity would have been apparent to me without the apple .
leonard_hofstadter You can not possibly be that arrogant .
sheldon_cooper You continue to underestimate me , my good man .
leonard_hofstadter Look , if you were n't happy with my presentation then maybe you should have given it with me .
sheldon_cooper As I have explained repeatedly , unlike you , I do n't need validation from lesser minds . No offence .
leonard_hofstadter Really , so why did you come ?
sheldon_cooper Because I knew you 'd screw this up .
leonard_hofstadter I did n't screw it up .
sheldon_cooper Oh , please . I admit , that spherical chicken joke , that was hilarious . But it was straight downhill from there .

leonard_hofstadter I 've had enough of your condescension . Maybe I did n't go to college when I was eleven like you , maybe I got my doctorate at 24 instead of 16 , but you are not the only person who is smarter than everyone else in this room . No offense . And I am clearly not the only person who is tormented by insecurity and has an ego in need of constant validation .
sheldon_cooper So you admit that you 're an egotist ?
leonard_hofstadter Yes . My name is Dr Leonard Hofstadter , and I could never please my parents so I need to get all my self - esteem from strangers like you . But he 's worse .
